title: New music thread
content:
okay since the previous one get bugged up because of the attack of the ezboard server, i thought i better start up a new thread for the music bought/copied or downloaded

now to start the new thread

[img]http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B0000025UW.01._SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg[/img]

BORN IN THE U.S.A - BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN
1: Born In The USA
2: Cover Me
3: Darlington County
4: Working On The Highway
5: Downbound Train
6: I`m On Fire
7: No Surrender
8: Bobby Jean
9: I`m Goin` Down
10: Glory Days
11: Dancing In The Dark
12: My Hometown

picked this up for $10 at leading edge music geelong, i can tell you if you have a leading edge in your area, you can pick up a cheap album if you are lucky to come across one, anyway this album scored 3 hits, it was released in 1984, if music fans love mid 1980s music they will want to buy this, now to look for his 1987 album (tunnel of love)

feel free to add to this thread as i created this to replace the old bugged one [url=http://www.dosvault.tk][img]http://venus.walagata.com/w/thedosvault/sig/tdv_banner.jpg[/img][/url]

WIPE OUT BUSH! WIPE OUT HOWARD!

title: Re: New music thread
content:
You buy some old new music.
A little while ago I picked up Colonel Claypool's Bucket of Bernie Brains: Big Eyeball in the sky. It's awesome. Les does less crazy bass playing and gets funkier than usual, and there's some great keyboards from Bernie Worrell. A must for anyone who doesn't want to suffer my scorn. title: haha
content:
I remember, in 4th grade, I had the lyrics to EXTREME's "Play with me" memorized (it's on the Bill and Ted soundtrack)... Ring around the rosie, hopscotch, Monopoly; red-light, green-light, G.I.Joes and Barbies... hide and seek, kick the can, Cowboys and Indians; whiffle-ball, tether-ball, hackey sack and HANG MAN!~

lmao. Hope you enjoy it.

title: Music Thread!!!
content:
Ahh... I may now force my must impeccable opinion on you all!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

Intro: I don't dance, I can't sing, and thus, I don't listen to dancing or music with jumpy lirics that often. I will, but due to the fact that I'm a more intulectuall person (and thus smarter that you [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] [najawa] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] [you]), I love soundtracks using a whole orchistra. Star Wars is amazing... but I don't have those CD's (yet)

I'd recommend the Lord of the Rings soundtracks! They are very well written, and will be the futures classical music. If I had to pick one, it'd be the Fellowship, because that has the best songs (exept that very cool Rohan Theme).

That would be the best music ever IMKO.

-- NAJAWA --

title: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content:
Purchased:
[img]http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B000007TUI.01._SCLZZZZZZZ_.jpg[/img]
1927 - ...ish
It's been ages since I've been able to listen to this (the last half, anyway--the first six or so are on their best-of). Ripped it countless times from Dad's copy, but the first CD I burnt it to died, and then twice I backed up my MP3s and formatted and the folder turned up empty both times, and now the original CD is lost amongst Dad's stuff somewhere.

[url=http://cgi.ebay.com.au/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&rd=1&item=4771595847&ssPageName=STRK:MEWA:IT]1927 - The Other Side[/url] (eBay)

Couldn't find the torrents, so I bought 'em.

Still yet to find their self-titled album and Erik Weideman's solo album.

Downloaded
Bon Jovi - Have A Nice Day
HIM - Dark Light
(and a bunch of others, but these are the most notable)Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content: Yeah, it's pretty lame to call yourself the most "intulectuall" person just because you like some 'classical' music. Besides, since you're listening that kind of music it probably means you can compose it as well and play every instrument. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] I listen to electronic music all the time and I can assure dancing and singing isn't required at all for listening (unless you have something wrong physically). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] Many tracks don't even have vocals.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Yeah, it's pretty lame to call yourself the most "intulectuall" person just because you like some 'classical' music. Besides, since you're listening that kind of music it probably means you can compose it as well and play every instrument. I listen to electronic music all the time and I can assure dancing and singing isn't required at all for listening (unless you have something wrong physically). Many tracks don't even have vocals. [hr][/quote]

Were you talking about me???

I was joking; I actually compose contemporary Christian!!!

My friend, Tim, is working on lirics. He gave me a copy (which I lost), so now I don't have it.

You can listen to my music (or download, if you give a crap).
[url=http://www.freewebs.com/najawa]Click Here[/url]

I also have some other composition there. The cable I used were my old spares, and were $0.50 mono-to-mono adapters, so the quality is not that good, but the music is Okay.

The contemprary christian does not have lirics yet, but is only a soundtrack. I have to say, it is pretty good for a first draft.

It shall improve!!!

I hope you like itProud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content:
Ok then. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Actually, not bad at all. I just listened Lord Jesus and Riders of Aragoth. Have you used some tracker or played it live somehow? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content:
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Najawa/diagpiano.jpg[/img]

I connected my Keyboard to my PC by hooking a cable from the headphone jack, and into my PC's microphone jack. The reason the quality is screwed is because, when I recorded it, I couldn't find my $50 worth of sterio cables, and addapters. Not willing to spend that much, I just picked up a new set (Mono) for around $1.50. My friend, Tim, wanted to hear the progress with Lord Jesus. We are thinking of changing the name sometime, but for now, Lord Jesus stands.

Then, I uploaded the sound files to my freewebs, and walla; KR has just heard my tricked out creation!!!

Edit: the ball is supposed the be the world wide web, but i forgot to color it in, and I think I just won't.Proud Leader of the "Tough Guys Wear Pink" Society
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/LLMod.jpg[/img]
"Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!"
-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Nineteen Twenty Seven.
content:
"This Means Forever" by Drop The Lime.

[img]http://www.tigerbeat6.com/photos/429888489.jpg[/img]

"Role Model" by Cex

[img]http://www.tigerbeat6.com/photos/615123512.gif[/img]

Just picked these up today and they sound awesome. Both are electronic music. The Drop The Lime is like hyper Breakcore Drum N Bass madness, while the Cex is chilled out glitchy IDM with smooth melodys and sharp, textural electronic drums and percussion. I'm enjoying them!

[img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

I'm listening it at the moment for the first time, sounding pretty good this far! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]

I've only heard one song by this band before this. I was just searching for a new album to buy and just decided to give this a try.Eat your veggies!

title: Who's Got The Last Laugh Now?
content: The new Scooter album simply ROCKS!!!!!!!!! It's definitely the best album of the year, and the best Scooter album this far.. Get it now!Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Who's Got The Last Laugh Now?
content: what style is it?  is it more of a dance thing?  if it is, thats not really my thing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] [img]http://www.denness.net/rpi/username/mr12000[/img]

title: Re: Who's Got The Last Laugh Now?
content: Yeah, it's more of the dance side, but not entirely. The beats are harder than in dance usually, and the tracks aren't like usual dance tracks and the MC HP's vocals are pretty good, as always. There's some trance tracks too (although I'm not the biggest fan of those). I'm sure you'd like it. At least listen the samples from the official page: [url=http://www.scootertechno.com/]www.scootertechno.com/[/url]Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Albums I've bought recently
content:
at the moment i am bidding 4 this on ebay

[img]http://81.176.74.183/covers/d/def_leppard/1983_-_pyromania/cover.jpg[/img]

this album was a big smash for the hard rock group def leppard, it was also revealed during the 1982 recording session that guitarist pete willis would be fired due to his drinking problem, and speaking of alcohol, steve clark found dead in his apartment somewhere in 1991 in the middle of the recording of adrenalize, he had taken a fatal overdose of pain killers & alcohol, in the days leading up to his death, he really tried to get off the drink, but sadly that wasn't to be

TRACK LISTING
1 Rock Rock (Till You Drop)
2 Photograph
3 Stagefright
4 Too Late For Love
5 Die Hard The Hunter
6 Foolin
7 Rock Of Ages
8 Comin` Under Fire
9 Action! Not Words
10 Billy`s Got A Gun

if you like this album it is worth getting the follow-up which produced even more hits

[img]http://81.176.74.183/covers/d/def_leppard/hysteria/cover.jpg[/img]

TRACK LISTING
1 Women
2 Rocket
3 Animal
4 Love Bites
5 Pour Some Sugar On Me
6 Armageddon It
7 Gods Of War
8 Don`t Shoot Shotgun
9 Run Riot
10 Hysteria
11 Excitable
12 Love And Affection

also in 1984 drummer rick allen lost his left arm & a year later for the recording sessions for hysteria his got himself a new drum kit & become an ever better drummer than he was previously with 2 arms

also look out for Yeah! which is due 4 release in 2006 & vivian campbell solo album, you can listen to some examples by visiting [url=http://www.viviancampbell.com/]www.viviancampbell.com/[/url]

content:
. . . Tu lascerai ogne cosa diletta
pi caramente; e questo quello strale
che l'arco de lo essilio pria saetta.
Tu proverai s come sa di sale
lo pane altrui, e come duro calle
lo scendere e 'l salir per l'altrui scale . . .

and...

Se mai continga che 'l poema sacro
al quale ha posto mano e cielo e terra,
s che m'ha fatto per molti anni macro,
vinca la crudelt che fuor mi serra
del bello ovile ov'io dormi' agnello,
nimico ai lupi che li danno guerra;
con altra voce omai, con altro vello
ritorner poeta, e in sul fonte
del mio battesmo prender 'l cappello . .

title: Re: Recent Purchases
content:
KR said exactly what I could have wrote a whole topic on in one post!

Do you, like, have jobs? (Retorical/Dumb question)

Anyways... I still can't dance now, but now I have a lock on my door... so my tastes have changed.

I've always liked country, but never listened to enough to get into it...

I found the time...

I also have listed to a bit of Rock lately, and some rap/R&B, and a bit of Pop.

I like songs not as much for the tune, as for what it is saying to me. I rarely buy albums. The last one I bought (and, other then the Lord of the Rings, which don't count, the first) was Carrie Underwood's Some Hearts.

I have a bunch by Lonestar, Alan Jackson, and Phil Vassar (I deperatly must get his new single "Last day of my life").

I also want a little Green Day. I just need a website which sells album only singles... legally...Tough Guys Wear Pink!!!
[img]http://i15.photobucket.com/albums/a371/najawa/Modding/tough_guys_wear_pink.jpg[/img]
Visit My site at [url=http://www.najawa.com]www.najawa.com[/url]
[url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?Najawa]Click Here!!! Please!!![/url]
-- NAJAWA --

title: TV On The Radio
content:
Recently purchased Return to Cookie Mountain by TV On The Radio... that is certainly a masterpiece. I also downloaded The Red And The Black by Jerry Harrison off of iTunes (it's not available on CD). Both amazing and extremely underrated pieces of work in the world of polyrhythmic (and pop) music.
[img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/16/Return_to_Cookie_Mountain.jpg/200px-Return_to_Cookie_Mountain.jpg[/img]
[img]http://image.allmusic.com/00/amg/cov200/drc900/c916/c9163613b1u.jpg[/img]------------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.
